description:
I can't find an XML schema for the OpenStack API v1.1 (nor the correct XML namespace)

Should we just be using the CloudServers v1.0 XSD schema, even with the v1.1 API?
title: No XML schema for OpenStack API v1.1?

comments.content:
I can't find an XML schema for the OpenStack API v1.1 (nor the correct XML namespace)

Should we just be using the CloudServers v1.0 XSD schema, even with the v1.1 API?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
Aha - thanks!

So the new XML NS is: http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1

I didn't see any XSD files ... any leads on those?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content: Jorge - can you point us to the v1.1 XSD please?  I think there are some changes, so we can't just use the v1.0 XSD.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
Hey guys the schemas along with many samples were checked in with the spec:

http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~annegentle/openstack-manuals/trunk/files/head:/doc/source/docbkx/openstack-compute-api/

-jOrGe W.

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jorgew

comments.content:
Thanks Jorge.  A couple of questions:

What's our policy on schema inheritance for (1) similar and for (2) identical objects in between versions?  How do we recommend that people implement their bindings to both versions (e.g. for CloudServers & for nova v1.1)?

I saw a new namespace: http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0  What's that?

In any case, do you want to propose these files for merge into lp:nova?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
On Mar 30, 2011, at 12:11 PM, justinsb wrote:

> Thanks Jorge.  A couple of questions:
> 
> What's our policy on schema inheritance for (1) similar and for (2)
> identical objects in between versions?  How do we recommend that people
> implement their bindings to both versions (e.g. for CloudServers & for
> nova v1.1)?
> 

That's a great question.  It would be *a lot* easier if you only supported one version at a time : -)  That said, it makes sense to have a single API that can talk 1.0 and 1.1, because you may have to interact with deployments  running either version.  You'll have to abstract the lower level details away...that is create your own language binding types and then have two ways of serializing them.  A user should be able to query what version he's bound to and if a request is not appropriate for a particular that should raise a not supported error or whatever.


> I saw a new namespace: http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0  What's
> that?

That's the namespace reserved for stuff that's common between APIs.  For example versioning, extension, and rate limiting requests will not vary between APIs.  The idea there is that when you're writing a language binding you can add support for this meta API stuff and share it between say the compute, volume, and image APIs etc.

> 
> In any case, do you want to propose these files for merge into lp:nova?

I'd like to, some things are still in the air though.  One big question that came up last week was how are we going to handle IDs for example.  There are also questions about how affinityId works.  So I still see the API 1.1 changing somewhat.  Maybe we should wait until it stabilizes a bit before we move it over. 

> 
> --

comments.content: I don't think this bug will ever get fully "fixed". If anything, schemas will be added piece by piece as we need them. Thierry, can we set this to Invalid?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content:
I've been publishing schemas in the manuals project with every release.  So this should be fixed.

-jOrGe W.
